attributes.action: Allow the public to trigger a vote of no confidence in the Government
attributes.additional_details: Currently only MPs can initiate a vote of no confidence. This leaves the public with no direct mechanism to act if they believe the Government has lost legitimacy between elections. A citizen-triggered process would strengthen democracy, rebuild trust, and ensure accountability. Rejecting this reform would show a lack of faith in the people’s right to hold power to account.
attributes.background: Introduce legislation that allows UK citizens to trigger a formal vote of no confidence in the Government through a petition process, giving the public a direct democratic tool to hold the Government accountable.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Give the British Public the Right to Vote No Confidence in the Government
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/734311
